column4: depends on just how badly it freezes. First try alt+f2. If the run window appears, type gnome-system-monitor and select to end the process. If nothing responds, press ctrl+alt+f2 and login (you'll be in a terminal session). From there run sudo ps ax|grep whateverwasrunning to find the process ID. Then sudo kill x, where x is the process ID you're trying ot kill.
